meanings.definition: In a way that leaves no doubt or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: She unequivocably stated her opinion on the matter.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were unequivocably clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: He unequivocably declared himself the king of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The truth of her words rang out unequivocably in the silent room.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the earthquake was unequivocably felt throughout the city.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is clear and unambiguous.
meanings.sent1: The teacher unequivocably explained the math problem to the students.
meanings.sent2: The contract was written unequivocably to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The cat unequivocably claimed the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: His love for her shone through unequivocably in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset painted the sky unequivocably.
